Title: Two US marines implicated in killing family in notorious Iraq war shooting, expert tells BBC
Description: New evidence raises doubts about the longest US war crimes investigation of the Iraq war and how US forces are held to account.

Title: How to land a consulting job these days, according to 'Case in Point' author Marc Cosentino
Description: "Case in Point" author Marc Cosentino says consulting job candidates need to focus on confidence, communication, and creative ideas.

Title: How women over 30 are rewriting the single mom narrative in America
Description:
Forty percent of babies in the U.S.
are born to unmarried mothers.
Increasingly, those moms are over 30, at a time when teen pregnancy has fallen off a cliff and births are declining for younger women.

Title: She lost her purse — but strangers stepped in to save the day
Description:
On a trip to Chicago, Lavonne Schaafsma lost her purse.
Two women saw a man rifling through it — and stepped in to help.

Title: More women are renting dresses, coats and ugly sweaters as clothing prices tick up
Description: More women are planning to deck the halls in rented fashion this year, just as inflation and tariffs are poised to push clothing prices higher.

Title: Alaska owns dozens of crumbling schools. It wants underfunded districts to take them on
Description:
Rural school district superintendents are trying to find the best use of limited resources.
Taking on the state's unmaintained buildings, they say, will only increase their burden.

Title: A guerrilla gardener installed a pop-up wetland in the LA River. Here's how — and why
Description:
Well-meaning city dwellers forgo permits and official procedure to rewild urban areas across the country.
In downtown LA, artist Doug Rosenberg is trying to push the grassroots movement forward.

Title: The Godmother of AI says young talent is 'overfocusing' on every detail of their career
Description: Young AI talent is overthinking too many aspects of their career, says Fei-Fei Li.

Title: This ex-Tesla engineer is bullish on lidar for robotaxis and humanoid robots
Description: Eric Aguilar, a former Tesla engineer, founded Omintron Sensors on a bet that self-driving cars and humanoid robots will need lidar for perception.

Title: Google who? How a new generation of media startups is thriving without search traffic
Description: New media startups like The Bulwark and Ankler Media are building their businesses with a focus on loyal subscribers over Google or Facebook traffic.

Title: Aaron Sorkin Says Studios “Wouldn’t Agree” To Make ‘The American President’ Today Because Half The Audience Would Be “Alienated”
Description: Oscar-winning scribe Aaron Sorkin said he doesn’t think studios “would agree” to make his political romantic dramedy The American President today because its...

Title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures rise as investors count down to Nvidia earnings, jobs report
Description: Investors get their first official read on the labor market this week after a shutdown-induced blackout.

Title: Stock market today: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq futures climb as traders look toward Nvidia earnings, jobs report
Description: The major gauges rose after a rocky week, as major players in the AI space failed to impress Wall Street with their earnings reports.

Title: Plaque unveiled for pioneering gay politician
Description: Sam Green is believed to be the first openly gay politician to be elected in the UK.

Title: Why McDonald's Will Probably Never Bring Back This Iconic Sandwich From The '80s
Description: McDonald's has tried some interesting food items in the past, but this rather iconic sandwich from the '80s is unlikely to ever return to menus.

Title: Ukraine signs a letter of intent to buy up to 100 Rafale warplanes from France
Description: Ukraine on Monday signed a letter of intent to buy up to 100 Rafale warplanes from France, the Ukrainian Embassy and the French president’s office said...

Title: Why are flags still flying at half-staff in Florida? What to know
Description: Flags continue to fly at half-staff in Florida and across the United States for former Vice President Dick Cheney.

Title: This city has the Bay Area's worst streets. It's not S.F. or Oakland
Description:
A new report from the Metropolitan Transportation Commission ranked every Bay Area city based on the conditions of its roads.
Here's what it showed.

Title: Electric vehicle sales are booming in South America — without Tesla
Description: By Lucinda Elliott and Marco Aquino MONTEVIDEO/LIMA (Reuters) -When Peruvian green energy entrepreneur Luis Zwiebach wanted to buy an electric vehicle in...
